intro: Adinandra subauriculata, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Adinandra subauriculata plays a role in forest ecosystems by influencing host tree growth and providing food for wildlife.
